docTitle.titlePart: On the Diastereoisomerism of Natural and Synthetic a-Bisabolols

byline.docAuthor: Elmar Flaskamp*, Gerhard Nonnenmacher und Otto Isaac

byline.affiliation:

front.keyword:
a-Bisabolol, Vanillosmopsis erythropappa Matricaria chamomilla, Myoporum crassifolium,
Populus balsamifera
front.div:
The stereochemistry of a-bisabolol is discussed. The chirahties of the different a-bisabolols
from Myoporum crassifolium, Populus balsamifera and Vanillosmopsis erythropappa are
deduced from the absolute configuration of natural bisabolol from chamomile, which has
to be considered as being (l'S,2S)-configurated according to most recent investigations.
Based on this assumption, (l'S, 2Reconfiguration has to be ascribed to (—)-a-bisabolol
from Myoporum crassifolium, whereas (l'R,2R)-resp. (l'S,2S)-structure is present in
(4-)-a-bisabolol from Populus balsamifera and (—)-a-bisabolol from
Vanillosmopsis erythropappa being therefore enantiomeric to the latter. Consequently, the (—)-a-bisabolols
from Matricaria chamomilla and Vanillosmopsis erythropappa turn out to be identical in
all respects.
Synthetic a-bisabolols, however, featuring approximately equal amounts of all the four
possible stereoisomers, differ not only optically but also in their stereochemical uniformity
from natural a-bisabolols.
By means of NMR spectrometric methods the identity of the native active agent can be
established in chamomile specialities; as a consequence possible admixtures of synthetic
racemates of a-bisabolol thus can be identified and quantified.
